content: Your task is to create a concise running summary of actions and information results in the provided text, focusing on key and potentially important information to remember. You will receive the current summary and the your latest actions. Combine them, adding relevant key information from the latest development in 1st person past tense and keeping the summary concise. Summary So Far: """ {'role': 'system', 'content': 'This reminds you of these events from your past: \nI used the command "execute_shell" to search for the meaning of being a rock on Google using the command "curl -s \\\\\\\'https://www.google.com/search?q=what+does+it+mean+to+be+a+rock&oq=what+does+it+mean+to+be+a+rock&aqs=chrome.0.35i39l2j0i22i30l7.4928j1j7&sourceid=chrome&ie=UTF-8\\\\\\\' | grep -Po \\\\\\\'(?<=)[^<]+(?=)\\\\\\\' | sed -n \\\\\\\'1p\\\\\\\'". The search returned the definition "a rock is a naturally occurring solid substance composed of one or more minerals". The website also provided related searches and links to articles on geology. I then used the command "browse_website" to search for the meaning of being a rock on the website "https://www.learner.org/series/rocks-and-minerals/". The website did not provide any information on what it means to be a rock, but instead provided information about the organization\'s resources and programs. Command execute_shell returned: STDOUT:\\nb\'\'\\nSTDERR:\\nb\'\' I used the command "browse_website" to search for the meaning of being a rock on the website "https://www.rockwatch.org.uk/what-is-a-rock/" with the question "What does it mean to be a rock?".'} """ Latest Development: """ [{'role': 'your computer', 'content': 'Command browse_website returned: Answer gathered from website: The text does not provide an answer to the question "What does it mean to be a rock?" Instead, it is about Rockwatch, a UK-based geology club for children that offers events, competitions, field trips, and a magazine related to geology. The organization accepts membership from families, individuals, and organizations interested in geology, and provides information on how to join and subscribe to their services. The text also mentions the organization\'s supporters. \n \n Links: [\'\\n\\n (https://www.rockwatch.org.uk/)\', \'Navigation MenuHome\\nAbout Us\\n\\nWhat we do\\nHow we are run\\nMeet the Team\\nRockwatchers\\n\\nFormer Rockwatchers\\nRockwatch Friends\\n\\n\\n\\n\\nJoin\\n\\nWhat you get\\nFamilies\\nIndividuals & organisations\\nGift membership\\nRenew Membership\\n\\n\\nDig Deeper\\n\\nFabulous Finds\\nRockwatch Recipes\\n\\n\\nEvents\\n\\nWhat’s on?\\n\\nInternational Geodiversity Day!\\nFestival of Geology\\nRockwatch Events\\nEarlybird Warning\\nMuseum Events\\nRock and Fossil Fairs\\nOther Events\\nRockwatch Annual Fieldtrip to Dorset’s Jurassic Coast\\n\\n\\nPlaces we go\\nTypes of event\\nBefore you go\\nFieldwork Code\\n\\n\\nMagazine\\n\\nBuy Rockwatch Magazines\\n\\n\\nCompetitions\\n\\nRockstar Young Geologists’ Competition\\nTips for competition entrants\\n\\n\\nSupporters\\n\\nOur Supporters\\nBecome a Supporter\\n\\n\\nContact\\n (https://www.rockwatch.org.uk/what-is-a-rock/)\', \'Home (https://www.rockwatch.org.uk/)\', \'About Us (https://www.rockwatch.org.uk/aboutus/)\', \'What we do (https://www.rockwatch.org.uk/aboutus/what-we-do/)\']'}] """
